intro: Brassica cretica convar. italica, commonly known as the Italian kale, is a leafy vegetable belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its curly, dark green leaves that are thick and sturdy. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small white or purple flowers. It thrives in cool climates and is often cultivated for its nutritional value and culinary uses. This variety is well-suited for growing in temperate regions and is a common crop in Mediterranean agriculture.
